meanings.definition: The act of operating a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: My dad's driving is always safe and steady.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the feeling of freedom when I go driving on the open road.
meanings.sent3: The driving of the car was so smooth that it felt like gliding on a cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her driving of the conversation led to a successful outcome.
meanings.sent5: The driving of the bus through the city was like a dance with traffic lights.

meanings.definition: Compelling or motivating someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The coach's pep talk was driving the team to give their best.
meanings.sent2: She was driving her friends to join her in the adventure.
meanings.sent3: His enthusiasm was driving everyone to participate in the event.
meanings.sent4: The urgent deadline was driving the team to work late hours.
meanings.sent5: The inspiring music was driving the crowd to dance all night long.

meanings.sent1: The storm brought driving rain and strong winds.
meanings.sent2: The actor delivered a driving performance that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The driving force behind the project was the team's determination to succeed.
meanings.sent4: The speaker's words had a driving impact on the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's determination was as driving as a powerful engine.
